name: clearspace
headline: eliminate compulsive phone usage
description: the missing layer of the internet that aligns how you actually spend your time with your best intentions

## clearspace: an intentionality layer
clearspace is a lever for you at your best to influence you at your most distractable
![](https://getclearspace.com/_next/static/media/phone-frame.d4b6b62a.svg)
### complete a centering exercise
take a moment before entering an app.
![](https://getclearspace.com/_next/static/media/phone-frame.d4b6b62a.svg)
### stay present or continue with limits
never get lost in the scroll again. tell us how long you want to be there and we'll pull you out at the end
![](https://getclearspace.com/clearspace-logo1.png)

## redesign your digital life
it's easy to impulse click and doom-scroll. clearspace lets you focus on what matters.
  * ### redirect impulse clicks
by enforcing a time buffer, clearspace retrains you to stop impulsively opening apps
  * ### session lengths
select the session length you need. clearspace pulls you out at the end, so you don't get lost in the scroll
  * ### data insights
track your progress over time with advanced analysis of your app usage patterns.

generated_description:
**Clearspace** is a San Francisco-based startup co-founded in 2022, currently part of Y Combinator's W23 batch. The company has a concise but profound mission: to eliminate compulsive phone usage—one of the biggest distractions in our modern lives. 

Imagine a tool that helps align how you actually spend your time with your best intentions. That's where Clearspace comes in. They describe themselves as the "intentionality layer" for your digital experience, aiming to retrain users to resist mindless scrolling and engage meaningfully with their devices.

The team, consisting of only five employees, is spearheaded by Jared Friedman as their Group Partner. Their innovative approach involves essential features such as session timers, app-specific usage limits, and data insights to help users track their progress over time.

How does it work? Users are encouraged to complete a centering exercise before diving into an app, setting boundaries to prevent getting lost in the digital abyss. Clearspace pulls them out when their designated time is up, effectively combating digital distractions. The platform also provides insights into app usage patterns, helping users redesign their digital lives and focus on what truly matters.

You can check out their offerings at [getclearspace.com](https://getclearspace.com), where you’ll find more details about the product, its features, and how it seeks to instill healthier phone habits. In a world where our devices often control us rather than vice versa, Clearspace is making a compelling case for intentional technology usage.
